disclaimer_start: Disclaimer: The following design is for informational purposes only and does not substitute professional architectural advice. Always consult a certified architect or building inspector before making any modifications.

rooms.description: Central living area with large windows for natural light and ventilation. Scandinavian minimalistic design.
Open dining space adjacent to the kitchen, designed for communal gatherings.
Modern Scandinavian kitchen with an open layout, incorporating energy-efficient appliances and wheelchair-accessible counters.
Master bedroom featuring a spacious balcony designed for wheelchair accessibility and abundant natural light. Vastu alignment ensures positive energy flow.
Second bedroom with its own balcony offering ample daylight, wheelchair accessible design, following Scandinavian aesthetics.
Third bedroom with a dedicated balcony for natural light and ventilation. Vastu compliance ensures energy balance.
Wheelchair accessible bathroom designed with Scandinavian style, ensuring safety and convenience.
Spacious balcony attached to bedroom_1 for enhanced outdoor experience while maintaining privacy.
Balcony attached to bedroom_2 ensuring accessibility and additional natural light.
Balcony attached to bedroom_3, designed for optimal daylight exposure and open view.

openings.description: Wheelchair accessible main entrance with Scandinavian minimalist design.
Large window in living room for natural light and ventilation.
Kitchen window ensuring daylight and connection to the outdoors.
Window in master bedroom for natural light with privacy features.
Dining area window providing ample ventilation and scenic views.
